election_record.label: Vermont 1813 Treasurer

overview.note: The Original Election Returns lists 21678 votes for Benjamin Swan and 574 scattering votes in Addison County; however, the sum of totals per town is 21711 for Benjamin Swan and 564 scattering.
"15th. The house met pursuant to adjournment ... The governor then ... made proclamation of the choice of Benjamin Swan, Treasurer." Rutland Vermont Herald (Rutland, VT). October 20, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns lists 2272 votes for Benjamin Swan and 70 scattering votes in Addison County; however, the sum of totals per town is 2262 for Benjamin Swan and 60 scattering.

sub_unit.name: Vergennes
sub_unit.note: The Official Results combines the totals for Vergennes and Waltham.

sub_unit.name: Bennington
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns lists 1111 votes for Benjamin Swan in Bennington County; however, the sum of totals per town is 1211.

sub_unit.name: Cabot
sub_unit.note: For Cabot, the Original Election Returns has the note "ballots not enclosed, not counted."

sub_unit.name: Sutton
sub_unit.note: In the Official Election Returns, Sutton is called Billymead.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns lists 1493 votes for Benjamin Swan in Franklin County; however, the sum of totals per town is 1438.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns lists 1987 votes for Benjamin Swan in Orange County; however, the sum of totals per town is 1983.

sub_unit.name: Orleans
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns lists 644 votes for Benjamin Swan in Orleans County; however, the sum of totals per town is 626.

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns lists 2946 votes for Benjamin Swan in Rutland County; however, the sum of totals per town is 2946.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Vermont State Archives, Middlesex.
